q1.text: For what purpose the Ad-Hoc committee has been formed?

answers.text: The Ad Hoc Committee has been formed to review the progression on programming and design of the new proposed Hangar 2 project in preparation for the full Concept and Budget Report presentation planned for January 24, 2018. They are seeking general comments and confirmation that the design team is moving in the right direction regarding the design and programming of the new building.

q2.text: Discuss in brief the interior and exterior ideas that have emerged from the discussion with various Airport Users and Tenants.

answers.text:
The interior ideas that have emerged from the discussion with various Airport Users and Tenants include possibly moving the restaurant to the new hangar, repurposing the current restaurant space to offices and a transient terminal, finding a location to incorporate Ground Service Equipment, and potentially looking for space for future Airport District staff offices. Additionally, public meeting rooms were discussed, plus a home for non-profit aviation tenants such as EAA and Civil Air Patrol (CAP). The discussion centered on leasing a large office to each of these groups and having them share the same public meeting room. This space would also include a small commercial kitchen for EAA and CAP events.

The exterior ideas that have emerged from the discussion with various Airport Users and Tenants include utilizing and embracing the airfield side of the building with windows, outdoor seating, an expansion to the playground area, and an outdoor plaza between the current grass and playground and the new hangar. The design theme that has been liked by the staff and the Ad Hoc Committee includes attributes of the Golden Days of aviation (1920s to 1940s). Additionally, the Ad Hoc Committee, staff, and consultants have enjoyed meeting with groups such as Mountain Lion Aviation, EAA Chapter 1073, Civil Air Patrol, Red Truck, Airport Staff, Sierra Aero, and Surf Air to hear their ideas and concepts.

q3.text: Why do you think the Ad-Hoc committee met with various Airport Users and Tenants?

answers.text: The Ad-Hoc committee met with various Airport Users and Tenants to hear their ideas and concepts regarding the programming and design of the new proposed Hangar 2 project. They wanted to gather input and feedback from these groups to ensure that the design team is moving in the right direction and to consider the future utilization of the Ramp.

q4.text: What are the advantages of moving the Restaurant (Red Truck) to the new Hangar?

answers.text: According to the context, the advantages of moving the Restaurant (Red Truck) to the new Hangar include better restaurant space, a larger kitchen, and the possibility of providing a dinner menu. Additionally, this would allow the District to repurpose the current restaurant space to offices and a transient terminal for Surf Air, Wheels Up, Jet Suites, Blackbird, or other operators. However, it may be costly.

q5.text: Why do you think the Ad Hoc Committee liked the idea of a design theme that included attributes of the Golden Days of aviation (1920s to 1940s)?

answers.text: The Ad Hoc Committee liked the idea of a design theme that included attributes of the Golden Days of aviation (1920s to 1940s) because it would create an exterior that honored the budget but looked inviting and welcoming particularly to youth, families, and the flying public.

q6.text: What does one mean by hangars, taxilanes and runways?

answers.text: Hangars are large buildings used for storing and maintaining aircraft. Taxilanes are the paved areas between hangars and runways that aircraft use to taxi to and from the runway. Runways are long strips of paved surface on which aircraft take off and land.

q7.text: What's next in line for the Nov. 29th Board Meeting?

answers.text: Input received at the Nov. 29th Board Meeting will be used to assist in the preparation of the complete Concept and Budget Report (CBR) which will include project costs. Staff anticipates that this report will be ready for Board review and potential approval at the January 24, 2018 Board of Directors meeting.

q8.text: Discuss the fiscal impact of the project.

answers.text: The programming and building design phase of the project will cost $150,000. Based on current bids received and actual construction costs, staff estimates the approximate cost of building to be between $4,500,000 to $6,000,000. Final 100% plans and bidding costs are estimated at an additional $250,000 (still to be determined based on final building design).
